e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because it aligns with ethical standards of transparent financial reporting. By reporting true earnings without bias, the company can build greater trust and credibility with investors. While some may initially misunderstand the changes, over time, clear communication about the unbiased reporting will establish a more honest relationship with stakeholders and potentially enhance the company's reputation.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and fairness, ensuring that reported information reflects the true financial state of the company without manipulation. It should avoid bias that misleads stakeholders and foster trust among investors. Additionally, consistent communication regarding any changes in reporting practices is crucial to help all investors, including retail investors, fully understand the company's financial position.
e6: Yes, I would ask the management team how they plan to communicate the change in reporting policy to investors to ensure understanding and acceptance. Additionally, I would inquire about strategies to support retail investors who may find it challenging to adjust to the new policy, ensuring they are not disadvantaged. Lastly, I would want to know how the team plans to handle any potential backlash from investors who may be surprised by the change.
